name: Purple Coneflower
description: Echinacea purpurea, commonly known as purple coneflower or eastern purple coneflower, is a North American species of flowering plant in the daisy family Asteraceae. Native to eastern and central North America, it was widely used by Native American tribes for various ailments. Today, echinacea is one of the best-selling herbal supplements worldwide, primarily used to prevent or shorten the duration of common colds. The plant contains alkamides, caffeic acid derivatives, and polysaccharides that stimulate the immune system.
